Use a fooInternal to do conditional assignment, leave foo as effectively final, for lambda.
Hope it will not get into future naming conflict.
timeline.author: weidongxu-microsoft
jianghaolu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -130,6 +131,27 @@ public ProxyMethod map(Operation operation) {
             parameters.add(Mappers.getProxyParameterMapper().map(parameter));
         }
 
+        if (settings.getAddContextParameter()) {
+            ProxyMethodParameter contextParameter = new ProxyMethodParameter(
+                "The context to associate with this operation.",
+                    ClassType.Context,
+                    ClassType.Context,
+                    "context",
+                    RequestParameterLocation.None,
+                    "context",
+                    true,
+                    false,
+                    true,

replies.bodyText:
I think I've copied it from v3.
Currently the flags is not used, since client code will use FluxUtil.withContext to let user provide context via reactor subscriberContext to the Mono/Flux after SDK call, as is currently done in manual code of storage data-plane (though it probably not working nicely for PagedFlux).
https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/storage/azure-storage-blob/src/main/java/com/azure/storage/blob/specialized/BlockBlobAsyncClient.java#L411
If we instead decide to let client provide 2 sets of client method (one with context, one without), then we would need isRequred=false here.
replies.author: weidongxu-microsoft

replies.bodyText: Just FYI client method parameters are ordered so that required params are asked first, and optional params follow.
replies.author: jianghaolu

replies.bodyText: I see. I've changed it to isRequired=false
replies.author: weidongxu-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: The way we currently generate in v3 is by adding the context on the method signature: https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/storage/azure-storage-blob/src/main/java/com/azure/storage/blob/implementation/BlobsImpl.java#L273
timeline.author: jianghaolu

replies.bodyText: Do you prefer we do this on v4 as well (add Context into client method)?
replies.author: weidongxu-microsoft

replies.bodyText: @srnagar may know the correct design for this
replies.author: jianghaolu
weidongxu-microsoft

replies.bodyText: I see this pattern is used across the existing SDKs. Not sure why they put it in the FluxUtil but fine.
replies.author: jianghaolu
